subject: p11293517
History: Recurrent pneumonias, presenting with malaise, cough.
Findings: Frontal and lateral views of the chest were obtained. Lung volumes are slightly less as compared to the prior study. Again, there is enlargement of the cardiomediastinal silhouette which is slightly more prominent as compared to the prior study, which may be due to AP techique and lower lung volumes. Left-sided pacer device is stable. Right-sided abandoned leads are also unchanged. There is mild pulmonary vascular congestion. No definite focal consolidation is seen. There is no pleural effusion or evidence of pneumothorax.
